column4: can someone please help my dvd-rw does not have a location and wont let me burn
is it a sata or IDE drive?
can you paste the output of "cdrecord -prcap"
What program did you use to burn?
have you tried running brasero as root?
hmm is your system up-to date?
well in theory it should work.. try using the cdrecord command
see if you can force it to use /dev/cdrw
sudo has to be installed... try using the prefix before the cdrecord command
its like windows' "run as service". when in the terminal you can prefix any command with "sudo " and it will run the command as root
